-JrhqsylKVdM3cridP5M.text: For decades, Israel has displaced Palestinians by seizing their land and through military occupation.

-JrhqsylKVdM3cridP5N.text: But it has also done it in another way: Deportation.

-JrhqsymJ7FVQEEQluOS.text: Israeli officials say it’s to protect national security. Palestinians say it’s illegal.

-JrhqsymJ7FVQEEQluOT.text: There’s been a series of mass deportations:

-JrhqsyndMZRxc01EARN.text: In 1992, 415 Palestinians were deported to South Lebanon.

-JrhqsyndMZRxc01EARO.text: In 2002, 39 were deported after a siege at the Church of the Nativity in Bethlehem.

-JrhqsyndMZRxc01EARP.text: In 2011, 180 Palestinians were deported in a prisoner exchange.

-JrhqsyoY0FEyO20ibR7.text: From Turkey, Jordan and Greece, we hear from them. They are bitter and homesick.

-Jrj1D-whJ_1mekrHDNV.text: This time Israel used a different strategy.

-Jrj1D-xBHWhI0bbTFwf.text: Instead of deporting Palestinians by military order, it struck a deal.

-Jrj1D-xBHWhI0bbTFwg.text: During the second Intifada, the Israeli army invaded Bethlehem and tried to capture Palestinian resistance fighters.

-Jrj1D-xBHWhI0bbTFwh.text: They were cornered, along with 200 other Palestinians inside the Church of the Nativity.

-Jrj1D-yE9c8mNQei57m.text: The Israeli military surrounded the Church… a standoff that lasted for 38 days.

-Jrj1D-yE9c8mNQei57n.text: Then, Israel offered them a deal:

-Jrj1D-zYmRsbO3Ln-_x.text: They could leave the Church unharmed, but 13 had to agree to go to Europe and 26 others, to the Gaza Strip.

-Jrj1D0-JHHjTdWkGD1P.text: It was difficult inside the church but more difficult when we left.

-Jrj1D00jw_QeAiJ_nSf.text: There was a deportation in 1948, another in 1967.

-Jrj1D01-xI7Hyf36p07.text: The third in 2002, after the Church of the Nativity.

-Jrj1D02OEKUDXWvFacY.text: Deporting 13 Palestinians was punishment against all the Palestinian people.

-Jrj1D03jc8KzFdwLGGb.text: Israel uses deportation to banish Palestinians from own land.

-Jrj1D04Oydevr8qzdCk.text: Abdullah Daoud, a senior Fatah leader was among those deported.

-Jrj1D06q8Lw4BYlTGUk.text: When they left the church, Abdullah volunteered to go first.

-Jrj1D07CXs_FV5dWC5J.text: If the Israelis planned to assassinate them, he would have been killed first.

-Jrj1D07CXs_FV5dWC5K.text: Mamdouh Al Wardian was also inside the church.

-Jrj1D0EOcmtOFPUmDGW.text: Israel deported thirteen Palestinians it considered terrorists.

-Jrj1D0K9HXaMdE4Os6Q.text: Twenty-six went to Gaza while the rest went home.

-Jrj1D0MgKzX9Nb1VV3h.text: The agreement was to deport the thirteen Palestinians to Italy for a year but Italy couldn't accept all of them.

-Jrj1D0MgKzX9Nb1VV3i.text: So they were deported to six different countries.

-Jrj1D0NvWCIZxJa6Sb_.text: Abdullah Daoud was deported to Mauritania.

-Jrj1D0PKO0Gk6lDYeFV.text: It was more difficult for our family because he'd endured deportation ten years earlier.

-Jrj1D0Qhm97IpRQBl7u.text: So we knew what it meant.

-Jrj1D0Qhm97IpRQBl7v.text: There was another mass deportation in 2011, part of an agreement with Hamas, to free captured Israeli soldier, Gilad Shalit.

-Jrj1D0RV-D62QiQRzVY.text: In total, more than a thousand Palestinians were freed from jail.

-Jrj1D0RV-D62QiQRzVZ.text: Forty of those were deported to Europe. 140 more to the Gaza Strip.

-Jrj1D0SyObH6lx_E-bC.text: Among them was Ahlam Al Tamimi, sentenced to life after helping in a suicide attack that killed 15 people.

-Jrj1D0SyObH6lx_E-bD.text: Her husband, Nizar Al Timimi was also part of the deal.

-Jrj1D0SyObH6lx_E-bE.text: He was jailed before her, for helping kill an Israeli settler.

-Jrj1D0TpRppFpdxz4Sg.text: She recalls visiting him in prison.

-Jrj1D0UEHInwuo3uab5.text: It's like entering an unknown world.

-Jrj1D0UEHInwuo3uab6.text: Israeli soldiers monitored everything, even our prison visits.

-Jrj1D0VLRNgCItJcOxI.text: Nizar and I could only embrace each other through our eyes.

-Jrj1D0WHz9JPlcrv1K0.text: I was very happy to see her.

-Jrj1D0WHz9JPlcrv1K1.text: At that moment, our relationship became serious.

-Jrj1D0YOqzoq4bCnFyB.text: I was violently arrested at home.

-Jrj1D0_XoitsUNvfr-G.text: Ahlam went to court at the same time as my cellmate.

-Jrj1D0_XoitsUNvfr-H.text: I rolled my letter into a capsule and asked him to give it to her.

-Jrj1D0_XoitsUNvfr-I.text: It meant a lot to her.

-Jrj1D0bnEthYxDTv008.text: The letter was a prisoner like us.

-Jrj1D0bnEthYxDTv009.text: I kissed, embraced and smelled it.

-Jrj1D0cG-uE1K8-X1pl.text: The Israeli prison service knew we were cousins.

-Jrj1D0d3fQVOAOnL32S.text: So we decided to get engaged.

-Jrj1D0e58bbS09uCW2_.text: When Gilad Shalit was captured in 2006 I felt closer to my dream.

-Jrj1D0e58bbS09uCW2a.text: In 2009, Hamas announced some prisoners would be released in exchange for proof, that Shalit was still alive.

-Jrj1D0fzM5y8m_nLk-F.text: Twenty female Palestinian prisoners will be released from Zionist jail.

-Jrj1D0gk4bHYjobQUj3.text: It took two more years of negotiations before a final deal.

-Jrj1D0hJIkDIZN7M0iU.text: Whenever we heard negotiations were progressing, we felt much better.

-Jrj1D0iqO3lb7dcvSgI.text: They released all the prisoners from Jerusalem except for Ahlam Al Tamimi.

-Jrj1D0iqO3lb7dcvSgJ.text: But we wanted all the female prisoners released.

-Jrj1D0kxLjRkEdVIFLs.text: The minute I heard the word deportation I was shocked.

-Jrj1D0kxLjRkEdVIFLt.text: I was against it, though I longed for Nizar and my freedom.

-Jrj1D0kxLjRkEdVIFLu.text: But I wasn't willing to wait any longer.

-Jrj1D0mHuN5kHAnSndQ.text: For someone who's been sentenced to life in prison deportation was the only way out.

-Jrj1D0necft-DdvPvmH.text: Staying in prison is like a death sentence.

-Jrj1D0necft-DdvPvmI.text: It was a difficult decision for prisoners.

-Jrj1D0o624Ezk0hKMty.text: So we took on this burden for them.

-Jrj1D0p5YADKSkdzjbO.text: We dreamed of arriving in Ramallah for a national feast and our wedding.

-Jrj1D0p5YADKSkdzjbP.text: On that day I felt conflicted.

-Jrj1D0qW2Z1P9HlFWVh.text: I was in a new place.

-Jrj1D0r3terj9Qjr_Te.text: We heard some prisoners would be deported.

-Jrj1D0r3terj9Qjr_Tf.text: It was like telling someone they’d had a baby but the mother died.

-Jrj1D0r3terj9Qjr_Tg.text: Tayseer Sabih was included in the Gilad Shalit prisoner swap.

-Jrj1D0stnS6emVgO9tV.text: It took five-and-a-half years of negotiations to release us.

-Jrj1D0tV68vq4xTR1rc.text: We were only included a month before the exchange took place.

-Jrj1D0uue3K4z5iiQTB.text: On the bus, a detainee said "I've been in prison for 20 years but I've never felt far from home."

-Jrj1D0uue3K4z5iiQTC.text: He said: "Now I know what what it means to be exiled."

-Jrj1D0v5lvVr3vk3uSJ.text: My home is close to Al Aqsa mosque.

-Jrj1D0wCAXnB55ElkZ7.text: Growing up in Jerusalem helped us understand the occupation's true objective.

-Jrj1D0xiVFi447dOZcu.text: It wants to remove and replace us.

-Jrj1D0yidI-YP548IDX.text: I pray in the mosques here but they're not like Al Aqsa mosque.

-Jrj1D0yidI-YP548IDY.text: When I eat hummus and falafel here it's not like eating in a restaurant in Jerusalem.

-Jrj1D1-xGDgTk-mMsjp.text: Israel has also used deportation to end Palestinian prisoners’ hunger strikes.

-Jrj1D1-xGDgTk-mMsjq.text: Hana Shalabi was first arrested in 2009, without charge.

-Jrj1D10M7Qwh0gRrMQM.text: She was released two years later as part of the Gilad Shalit prisoner exchange.

-Jrj1D11PEJYxT1kaQMK.text: Four months after that, she was re-arrested – again without charge.

-Jrj1D11PEJYxT1kaQML.text: Prison for the second time was unbearable for her.

-Jrj1D12dZZ84hcRKS6y.text: I gave them a hard time.

-Jrj1D13tckunafKyAaI.text: I couldn’t accept being strip searched

-Jrj1D13tckunafKyAaJ.text: In front of six soldiers, a nurse and a female soldier.

-Jrj1D143Y2ma0RLBfck.text: The female soldier let them do it.

-Jrj1D143Y2ma0RLBfcl.text: I tried to fight back but I was cuffed.

-Jrj1D15XCQGQTZdDHJm.text: My body was covered with scratches from the soldiers’ nails.

-Jrj1D16bapgYJpII71n.text: He took off all my clothes in front of seven soldiers.

-Jrj1D16bapgYJpII71o.text: This was when I decided to go on hunger strike.

-Jrj1D17Go6v7EYPW3c4.text: After 43 days, Hana’s health was failing. Medical reports warned she was close to death.

-Jrj1D1Ml_drfyrwjXDN.text: They deliberately brought boxes of clementine’s and then the soldiers would peel the fruit so the smell spread into the room and then they threw it away without eating it.

-Jrj1D1RU3yCwg5pIXbY.text: This smell is very bad for strikers’ health.

-Jrj1D1Szck1o7xbYNbT.text: It makes them want to vomit but there is nothing in their stomach.

-Jrj1D1Szck1o7xbYNbU.text: Palestinians protested across the occupied territories in solidarity….

-Jrj1D1UaQbRUOZQryso.text: When I was in solitary in Ramla, I heard the sound of kids playing.

-Jrj1D1UaQbRUOZQrysp.text: I thought I was losing my mind. I was only there for a few weeks.

-Jrj1D1UaQbRUOZQrysq.text: What must it be like for someone there for years.

-Jrj1D1V5iJgL3jSPW4Y.text: Israel released her, but only after she agreed to be deported to Gaza for three years.

-Jrj1D1Y_frlhDhdxVtO.text: I was sure I’d eventually die in jail.

-Jrj1D1ZYHHRDGwhD0V8.text: The Israeli authorities were stubborn and I also stuck to my guns.

-Jrj1D1afaapoX964AtP.text: I was absolutely certain I was going to die there.

-Jrj1D1cMfj1j_ufkA0B.text: The United Nations says deportation is illegal…

-Jrj1D1dO01pVouoMuRe.text: FORMER UN RAPPORTEUR FOR HUMAN RIGHTS

-Jrj1D1dO01pVouoMuRf.text: A person should not be deported in the first place but if that person is deported, he or she should be allowed to return.

-Jrj1D1e-JNSiAbdAzGv.text: And so it is a very unfortunate situation with the rules of the international law are very clear, Israel is in violation of these rules but there is no political will on the part of the international community to enforce these laws.

-Jrj1D1e-JNSiAbdAzGw.text: The rules of the international law are very clear, Israel is in violation of these rules but there is no political will on the part of the international community to enforce these laws.

-Jrj1D1gPy8G4gpJSpYH.text: Legally, we are not talking about occupied territories but disputed areas managed by Israel.

-Jrj1D1gPy8G4gpJSpYI.text: This means the Geneva Convention doesn’t apply.

-Jrj1D1hcnDbXzbSFF78.text: Meanwhile…Palestinians confront new struggles in exile…

-Jrj1D1hcnDbXzbSFF7A.text: The day before we arrived, Israel warned Greece we were a terrorist threat.

-Jrj1D1jryry9nEebGHs.text: My father's death was difficult for me.

-Jrj1D1jryry9nEebGHt.text: I couldn't see him when he was sick.

-Jrj1D1kRkQfP6avwYa0.text: I couldn't do anything for him.

-Jrj1D1kRkQfP6avwYa1.text: And for some, deportation can end in death…

-Jrj1D1l7zPzSxXYPR60.text: We face deportation, suffering, and the threat of assassination.

-Jrj1D1l7zPzSxXYPR61.text: For decades, Israel has displaced Palestinians by seizing their land and through military occupation.

-Jrj1D1mYFqv1izPxjhI.text: But it has also done it in another way: Deportation.

-Jrj1D1mYFqv1izPxjhJ.text: Israeli officials say it’s to protect national security. Palestinians say it’s illegal.

-Jrj1D1n9bFj9mAq4msj.text: There’s been a series of mass deportations:

-Jrj1D1n9bFj9mAq4msk.text: In 1992, 415 Palestinians were deported to South Lebanon.

-Jrj1D1oxd9jDgAaK4gb.text: In 2002, 39 were deported after a siege at the Church of the Nativity in Bethlehem.

-Jrj1D1oxd9jDgAaK4gc.text: In 2011, 180 Palestinians were deported in a prisoner exchange.

-Jrj1D1oxd9jDgAaK4gd.text: Deportees have been sent to Arab and European countries…

-Jrj1D1pGvcHKrCIiZ8q.text: From Turkey, Jordan and Greece, we hear from them. They are bitter and homesick.

-Jrj1D1pGvcHKrCIiZ8r.text: They speak of the loss of their loved ones, and of their homeland.

-Jrj1D1qYR88q_klZ9p5.text: Tayseer Sabih was among those deported from Bethlehem.

-Jrj1D1qYR88q_klZ9p6.text: In Istanbul, more than a decade later, he’s still struggling…

-Jrj1D1rSfc7TcNnM9nO.text: I suddenly found myself in a strange country with a new language and traditions.

-Jrj1D1u3PQz5e7rJHA4.text: We work hard to earn a living and to pay rent.

-Jrj1D1wEsSqGlMn1kem.text: I have Turkish journalist credentials to work in the media.

-Jrj1D1wEsSqGlMn1ken.text: I work on content mainly about Jerusalem.

-Jrj1D1xfevnvtFRqqNE.text: Tayseer honours his homeland through his work, but also through his family.

-Jrj1D1y39rkJ1zAqk0e.text: A Turkish friend asked why I named my daughter Tabarak Quds.

-Jrj1D1zeqZGuqWu-sph.text: I said it makes me feel like

-Jrj1D1zeqZGuqWu-spi.text: I'm in Al Quds, Jerusalem praying in Al Aqsa mosque and visiting the Church of the Resurrection.

-Jrj1D2-zM-cvmYOgENN.text: My daughter symbolises my hope for the future.

-Jrj1D2-zM-cvmYOgENO.text: If my daughter could live in Jerusalem, my house awaits her.

-Jrj1D20AZG-Riu26qnf.text: MUSTAFA HAMAYEL has moved half a dozen times since Israel’s Supreme Court ordered him deported in 1988.

-Jrj1D20AZG-Riu26qng.text: From South Lebanon, he moved to Iraq, Algeria, Yemen, Tunisia. Eventually; he settled here in Jordan.

-Jrj1D22X55W5wOA_DAD.text: People said us there wasn't much work in Jordan.

-Jrj1D22X55W5wOA_DAE.text: I struggled before finding a job in excavation.

-Jrj1D231X3kznkMMzck.text: I leave home at 6.30am without breakfast.

-Jrj1D231X3kznkMMzcl.text: We work very hard to earn a living.

-Jrj1D24gPvkFkHttE9c.text: But having a job isn’t enough for Hemayal to get by.

-Jrj1D256jUN9fPiY3AN.text: I don't have a national number on my Jordanian passport.

-Jrj1D263r6egcvN0VNE.text: I can't buy a car or land in my own name.

-Jrj1D271CsnOpNzrHL1.text: We had trouble finding schools for our children.

-Jrj1D271CsnOpNzrHL2.text: The authorities said they couldn't attend school because they're Palestinian.

-Jrj1D2926E62UWGN5sC.text: Then let me go back to Palestine.

-Jrj1D2Bgiu4Nuwt4Jfy.text: My two daughters are married and live in Palestine.

-Jrj1D2C56DjqVvDacdL.text: I told them to stay there.

-Jrj1D2C56DjqVvDacdM.text: Mustafa’s son, Ahmed lives in the occupied West Bank.

-Jrj1D2DFT7MHfWcQk0q.text: He is trying to bring his father home.

-Jrj1D2EiJkp-a1V3CiI.text: We've tried to bring them back.

-Jrj1D2FYWo3lc3gZObs.text: We’ve applied for a permit every month for the past seven years.

-Jrj1D2GzxRZ_MaB7RCz.text: It's difficult when the children ask about their grandfather.

-Jrj1D2H9-l8NjqEccpA.text: They only speak to him on the phone.

-Jrj1D2H9-l8NjqEccpB.text: Mustafa, hasn’t returned home since being deported to Jordan…not even to attend his father’s funeral.

-Jrj1D2JwIO2wi9hYyvC.text: My father's death was difficult for me.

-Jrj1D2JwIO2wi9hYyvD.text: I couldn't see him when he was sick.

-Jrj1D2Kdw6hkfGH_CRD.text: I couldn't do anything for him.

-Jrj1D2Kdw6hkfGH_CRE.text: Nizar Al Tamimi is another Palestinian banned from being with his deported family.

-Jrj1D2Kdw6hkfGH_CRF.text: He was able to be reunited with his wife, Ahlam… but at a cost.

-Jrj1D2M-2Ljnvi2tTao.text: I wanted to be with Ahlam but it was a struggle.

-Jrj1D2NSwlNBclGxaoU.text: The Zionist enemy made him choose between deportation to Jordan for five years or staying in Palestine.

-Jrj1D2OCfZgXk1dU2lg.text: We wanted a compromise that would allow him to visit me and return to Palestine.

-Jrj1D2SgZ3m2wj-CkX5.text: Palestinian journalist GHAZI AL SAADI, was also deported to Jordan.

-Jrj1D2TdwiL_4HI0Tuv.text: He spent seven years in jail for protesting against the Israeli occupation.

-Jrj1D2TdwiL_4HI0Tuw.text: Today he runs a study centre.

-Jrj1D2U9ZhE1pHgB272.text: I looked for any means of resisting the occupation.

-Jrj1D2Vwp_lLrqWKTsZ.text: That's how I ended up in prison.

-Jrj1D2WdbTfddDyWSKb.text: On 25th March 1977, I was deported to Jordan.

-Jrj1D2YL6CE5UoN69V_.text: I wrote reports on the Palestinian resistance and sent them to Fatah leader Khalil Al Wazeer, Abu Jihad.

-Jrj1D2_u2smf2lwbfVh.text: I asked him to open a publishing house.

-Jrj1D2atVxRIgQ56LXl.text: I also wanted it to be a study centre.

-Jrj1D2e-Csr1w49a-UO.text: When he asked about a permit. I said I'd try get one.

-Jrj1D2fMpWz8h9orrqQ.text: We opened the Dar Al Jaleel Publishing House.

-Jrj1D2hhsPsNDiyz7yt.text: It has expanded and is now well-known.

-Jrj1D2i8xu3CEvLe7U9.text: -Can you take a picture of me?

-Jrj1D2i8xu3CEvLe7UA.text: Mamdouh Al Wardian was deported in 2002, after the siege of the Church of the Nativity, in Bethlehem.

-Jrj1D2nK8jGaFv0fnab.text: When he arrived here in Greece he faced new problems…

-Jrj1D2pR6kagebjVGX9.text: Israel warned Greece we were a terrorist threat.

-Jrj1D2pR6kagebjVGXA.text: They urged Greece to reject us.

-Jrj1D2pR6kagebjVGXB.text: Mohammad Mohanna was with Al Wardian in the Church of the Nativity.

-Jrj1D2qqwWUQ3aI9G9r.text: He was also deported to Greece.

-Jrj1D2rJjkrptx6GIH5.text: But the fact is we’re deportees.

-Jrj1D2tcLe9XxBawkiB.text: We’ve worked hard to prove ourselves.

-Jrj1D2tcLe9XxBawkiC.text: I studied dental technology and opened my own laboratory.

-Jrj1D2tcLe9XxBawkiD.text: I work long hours to make a living.

-Jrj1D2uQI2Qklqj0-ML.text: I was accepted in dentistry school.

-Jrj1D2uQI2Qklqj0-MM.text: Mamdouh teaches his daughter about Palestine. She has never been there.

-Jrj1D2wxkhvo10W5B0E.text: I put my daughter in a nursery.

-Jrj1D2wxkhvo10W5B0F.text: It was difficult at first but now she comes home happy.

-Jrj1D2wxkhvo10W5B0G.text: She's learned a few Greek words.

-Jrj1D2yqrxHSVJ6yZzL.text: My daughter learns about Greece but I also teach her to love Palestine.

-Jrj1D2yqrxHSVJ6yZzN.text: Here, in Athens, the deportees mix with Greeks who are free to live and work in the occupied Palestinian territories.

-Jrj1D2zT5mlpbr1YqWe.text: [Man]: My brother's going to work there.

-Jrj1D2zT5mlpbr1YqWf.text: I'm afraid he might get killed.

-Jrj1D32ZZ-1n9vyGY8r.text: His brother’s going to work in Palestine, But I’m Palestinian, but can’t return.

-Jrj1D33_AqqcXCdEz2g.text: I've spent Eid without family or friends for the past nine years.

-Jrj1D35qOqinQvDAOKi.text: I can sum up my suffering in one word: deportee.

-Jrj1D35qOqinQvDAOKj.text: To be away from your country has many meanings.

-Jrj1D37EgXUkMNQb5mI.text: We thought we'd only be deported for a year.

-Jrj1D37EgXUkMNQb5mK.text: We are deported without trial or even being charged.

-Jrj1D37EgXUkMNQb5mL.text: No one's talking about our cause which is dangerous.

-Jrj1D38py38e8O_Von5.text: The United Nations has tried to raise the deportees’ cause with Israel – to no avail.

-Jrj1D38py38e8O_Von6.text: It says Israel is breaking international law by deporting Palestinians from occupied territories.

-Jrj1D39x-QMDESceP07.text: FORMER UN RAPPORTEUR FOR HUMAN RIGHTS

-Jrj1D39x-QMDESceP08.text: A person should not be deported in the first place but if that person is deported, he or she should be allowed to return.

-Jrj1D3ASMbU9QqcUkIM.text: And so it is a very unfortunate situation with the rules of the international law are very clear, Israel is in violation of these rules but there is no political will on the part of the international community to enforce these laws.

-Jrj1D3BLmSMOZlOLAY5.text: Legally, we are not talking about occupied territories but disputed areas managed by Israel.

-Jrj1D3Cx4mG_pMLxCiw.text: This means the Geneva Convention doesn’t apply.

-Jrj1D3Cx4mG_pMLxCix.text: Israel has applied it, even though it doesn’t have to.

-Jrj1D3DYHp9D9WeCX8s.text: FORMER UN RAPPORTEUR FOR HUMAN RIGHTS

-Jrj1D3DYHp9D9WeCX8t.text: This argument has been rejected by the International Court of Justice in 2004. The international court gave an advisory opinion on the illegality of the wall that Israel is building in the Palestinian territory but in passing it made it very clear that Israel is bound by the provisions of the fourth Geneva Convention. So Israel is a party to this convention. It should accept it.

-Jrj1D3EXQz-nqdSWBpv.text: For now, the deportees are not welcome back.

-Jrj1D3EXQz-nqdSWBpw.text: Some worry they’ll die in exile.

-Jrj1D3FvJwiUBuco3Yd.text: Others wonder whether they will ever return home.

-Jrj1D3HDtqpYnVCKkKs.text: My husband, Abdullah, dreamed of returning to Palestine.

-Jrj1D3IuxzlyHii09Mf.text: After eight years of deportation, he returned in a coffin.

-Jrj1D3IuxzlyHii09Mg.text: I returned with his dead body.

-Jrj1D3LeN5cz5aCCL2A.text: I asked for a picture of my father's grave to remind me to visit one day.

-Jrj1D3MCHGzDBWwBmMS.text: We face deportation, suffering and assassination.

-Jrj1D3Oc1204TLj8D38.text: It's difficult to live like this.

-Jrj1D3PBNCoEL6hnHST.text: Every day could be our last.

-Jrj1D3PBNCoEL6hnHSU.text: I wonder who'll be assassinated first, my husband, Nizar or me.

-Jrj1D3RCQoskUt4jtxM.text: The Zionists pursue Palestinians wherever they are.

-Jrj1D3StylAdjql1WMA.text: In 2004, IZZ EL DEEN AL SHEIKH KHALIL  a Palestinian deportee was killed by a car bomb in Damascus.

-Jrj1D3StylAdjql1WMB.text: Israel was accused of ordering the assassination.

-Jrj1D3Tl8Fg8lIO0GCU.text: He was buried in Damascus near Al Mabhouh’s grave.

-Jrj1D3UlgDWSmU4JrWc.text: They were both members of Hamas.

-Jrj1D3UlgDWSmU4JrWd.text: We'll rebury him in Gaza when we can.

-Jrj1D3VMzthFKqHV_9B.text: A deportee who serves the Palestinian cause will never be forgotten.

-Jrj1D3VMzthFKqHV_9C.text: And most Palestinian deportees continue to fight the Israeli occupation from a distance.

-JrjGZnPF4vE-eajYn2Q.text: فالمغرب، قام على  علاقة تقارب بين اليهوديّة والإسلام، وهذا أمرٌ نادرٌ في التّاريخ

-JrjGZnPF4vE-eajYn2R.text: واليوم نعيد إحياء جذور الصويرة و النّهوض بها بناءً على قِيَم وأخلاقيّات  التّاريخ بين اليهوديّة والإسلام

-JrjGZnQezpAV0ndDqi1.text: يهودي مغربي بقي في المغرب ولم يهاجر

-JrjGZnQezpAV0ndDqi2.text: أنا آخر يهوديّ في الصويرة، الذّاكرة الحيّة

-JrjGZnRXvP8LpIRwOq4.text: وعندما أقول: اليهوديّ الأخير، لا أعني أنّهُ ليس هناك يهودٌ آخرون هنا، لكنّهم أتوا من فرنسا أو الولايات المتّحدة الأميركيّة أو أماكن أخرى

-JrjGZnRXvP8LpIRwOq5.text: اليهوديّ الوحيد الذي وُلِد في الصويرة وما زال يعيش هنا

-JrjGZnSPe8e2oKWEaVN.text: اصطحبتُهم  لزيارة الميناء والمقبرة، وفجأةً، واحدٌ من أقربائي إنفجر  بالبكاء

-JrjGZnSPe8e2oKWEaVO.text: ولمّا سألتُهُ عن السّبب، قال لا يعلم كيف ولماذا ترك والداهُ  الصويرة، هذه المدينة الرّائعة، ليسكنا في إسرائيل

-JrjI_h4pBCy-ndmjgaU.text: They’re at the burial site of a rabbi… Amram ben Diwan...

-JrjI_h54ps920DY5tT0.text: Rabbi Diwan was sent here in the 18th century to collect donations from the Jewish community, for the Holy Land.

-JrjI_h54ps920DY5tT1.text: A quarter of a million Jews once lived in Morocco… the largest Jewish community in the Arab World.

-JrjI_h6yogLuElaXeis.text: But when Israel was founded in 1948, many were persuaded to leave. Today, only 2,000 remain.

-JrjI_h6yogLuElaXeit.text: For those who left, their ties to Morocco are still strong.

-JrjI_h7bad4Smynj1do.text: I’m in Ouazzane for a pilgrimage.

-JrjI_h8vcujSR_QEmbH.text: Amram ben Diwan performed miracles 150 years ago.

-JrjI_h8vcujSR_QEmbI.text: This is part of my culture.

-JrjI_h9ONW2gUN0pcfC.text: When I was child, pilgrimages were strong experiences.

-JrjI_hBJ4B6yhYUzMxv.text: My father and my mother are originally from Morocco, Casablanca.

-JrjI_hCQTow5oZfxb3o.text: And we come for the ‘Hillula’of the ‘Tzadiq’ Amram Ben Diwan.

-JrjI_hDQxEXk_-DwUzV.text: In Morocco, there are saints everywhere Jews lived.

-JrjI_hDQxEXk_-DwUzW.text: Every Moroccan Jew has a chance

-JrjI_hF9bUV072yU2v_.text: My name is Sam Garcon. I’m from Gibraltar,

-JrjI_hF9bUV072yU2va.text: I’m originally from Morocco. I try to come back every year.

-JrjI_hGd5uZOvLe8B5X.text: This year, 80 people came from Gibraltar.

-JrjI_hH2hZs8AHhEZJB.text: This was the Jewish neighbourhood, a Mellah.

-JrjI_hI1bwRvBpoQSOU.text: Jews have lived Morocco for more than 2,000 years .

-JrjI_hI1bwRvBpoQSOV.text: The end of Islamic rule in the Andalusia region of Spain in 1492 added to their numbers.

-JrjI_hI1bwRvBpoQSOW.text: But after Israel was founded in 1948, the tide began to turn.

-JrjI_hJnw_UPzQY-Q1H.text: Jews started leaving Morocco for Israel -- their journey facilitated by Mossad, Israel’s secret service. It said Jews needed to be rescued from persecution.

-JrjI_hJnw_UPzQY-Q1I.text: In this film, we hear from those who left Morocco, those who stayed, and those who left but chose to return.

-JrjI_hKcqGgd_8R0Hzt.text: We begin in the village of Agouim. It still has an ancient Jewish neighbourhood called a ‘Mellah’.

-JrjI_hNy_qF_g11dA3L.text: I remember life when I was a child.

-JrjI_hOBxOS1zmCmVw6.text: Berber Jews were no different from Muslims here.

-JrjI_hOBxOS1zmCmVw7.text: We lived in the same houses.

-JrjI_hOBxOS1zmCmVw8.text: A Muslim family lived next door to a Jewish one.

-JrjI_hRRAFqOlZbfSVg.text: When I was young, my father wanted us to leave for Israel.

-JrjI_hRRAFqOlZbfSVh.text: We came here where 12 green buses were waiting.

-JrjI_hRRAFqOlZbfSVi.text: All the Jews from this area boarded them and left.

-JrjI_hSUOyS28OlARxu.text: About 90 per cent settled in the same area in Israel.

-JrjI_hSUOyS28OlARxv.text: It was a village like this one.

-JrjI_hSUOyS28OlARxw.text: Every time I visited Morocco people, asked why we left.

-JrjI_hTGG3-Ne_piSQT.text: The Jews from Agouim had no reason to leave.

-JrjI_hTGG3-Ne_piSQU.text: I helped carry luggage, when the Jews boarded the buses.

-JrjI_hVJk1hKdRDSQX9.text: When they left, their amazing Jewish food went with them.

-JrjI_hVJk1hKdRDSQXA.text: We no longer danced traditional Ahwach.

-JrjI_hVJk1hKdRDSQXB.text: We didn’t want them to leave.

-JrjI_hWjzr7I1Supq_x.text: Some Moroccan Jews that left later regretted their decision.

-JrjI_hXiOUjGTd1IJkY.text: Fanny Mergui immigrated to Israel as a teenager.

-JrjI_hXiOUjGTd1IJkZ.text: She studied psychology in France. She also became a political activist.

-JrjI_hZxH9CHTRIdTsH.text: In 1912, my grandfather arrived on a donkey from the Marrakesh region.

-JrjI_hZxH9CHTRIdTsI.text: His family owned a grocery shop.

-JrjI_h_XfaaQY3jQaIm.text: In Casablanca, they made a fortune in 20 years.

-JrjI_h_XfaaQY3jQaIn.text: For people who only used Hebrew, this was fantastic success.

-JrjI_hazFF7KXoZoL5-.text: They wrote with Hebrew letters but it read like Moroccan Arabic.

-JrjI_hbs9LQY1PhgEhv.text: There was harmony between Muslim and Jewish culture.

-JrjI_hbs9LQY1PhgEhw.text: What defined us back then? It was religion.

-JrjI_hcVrJVixBp-1-f.text: Moroccan identity didn’t exist.  We were either Jewish or Muslim.

-JrjI_hcVrJVixBp-1-g.text: As far as I can recall, this wasn’t a problem.

-JrjI_hd5zrJCaQYqtYB.text: This is the Bab Marrakesh area.

-JrjI_hd5zrJCaQYqtYC.text: This square marked the beginning of the ‘kingdom of the Jews’.

-JrjI_heoX4_L2w4LYUN.text: Look at those small streets. People weren’t wealthy.

-JrjI_heoX4_L2w4LYUO.text: Of course, some streets are bigger.

-JrjI_heoX4_L2w4LYUP.text: These small houses belonged to Moroccan Jews.

-JrjI_hfQbdat-0nAsx5.text: They left for Israel from here. Most were lower class.

-JrjI_hfQbdat-0nAsx7.text: Most Jews had the same standard of living as other Moroccans.

-JrjI_hg6OA5NyVyKX_0.text: We were all under colonial rule which monopolized the country’s wealth.

-JrjI_hg6OA5NyVyKX_1.text: There were a lot of Jews here.

-JrjI_hhqgDdR4Vbr0YX.text: They were shoe makers, butchers or bakers.

-JrjI_hhqgDdR4Vbr0YY.text: They had homes but they all left.

-JrjI_hhqgDdR4Vbr0YZ.text: I remember my father saying that Jews lived with us.

-JrjI_hixzkbORJB4Tj8.text: Issa, Moshe, Meyer and Abdel Wahed Souiri.

-JrjI_hixzkbORJB4TjA.text: They had shops here. They sold olives.

-JrjI_hjQnm2Fu9zcGqL.text: It was crowded and the markets thrived.

-JrjI_hjQnm2Fu9zcGqM.text: They left and now it’s empty.

-JrjI_hkuPUJxLY9cgTP.text: We were business partners and we prospered.

-JrjI_hkuPUJxLY9cgTQ.text: Mossad, played a crucial role in facilitating the emigration of Jews to Israel.

-JrjI_hkuPUJxLY9cgTR.text: In 1954, it sent one of its agents to Morocco to set up a secret base.

-JrjI_hlQ2qboxlWA98b.text: Mossad feared Morocco’s Jews would be in danger when the country became independent from France. At the same time Israel was trying to bolster its population.

-JrjI_hlQ2qboxlWA98c.text: Mossad made a plan to bring hundreds of Moroccan Jews to Israel each month.

-JrjI_hlQ2qboxlWA98d.text: Agents inside Morocco organized secret transportation routes across the Mediterranean sea to Israel.

-JrjI_hmJTEZGUu2T_08.text: First, the immigrants were brought to the British territory of Gibraltar, near Spain.

-JrjI_hmJTEZGUu2T_09.text: There, they changed boats and continued their journey to Israel.

-JrjI_hoKl9LS-rMx-Bm.text: -Yes. This is what we were taught.

-JrjI_hoKl9LS-rMx-Bn.text: The truth is Zionist propaganda was very intense.

-JrjI_hpqlmhoXv85SJ5.text: ADVISOR TO THE KING OF MOROCCO

-JrjI_hqNwyfwbCHNQ5_.text: The Jewish community experienced French colonisation

-JrjI_hrnvgZNxE0FL0V.text: Also, wars in the Middle East

-JrjI_hrnvgZNxE0FL0W.text: This created an opportunity for Israel

-JrjI_hs97KZMS3I1fdn.text: The sea used to be here where the buildings are now.

-JrjI_htIGagN_lL0x6S.text: For years, I watched entire families

-JrjI_hu0MZX8vKInIfU.text: Here, the boat waited to take them to the ‘Promised Land’.

-JrjI_hu0MZX8vKInIfW.text: For months, as a child, I was terrified.

-JrjI_hvponhO2Jt7jwf.text: I cried because they were all leaving.

-JrjI_hvponhO2Jt7jwg.text: Year after year, the streets of the old city and the Mellah

-JrjI_hvponhO2Jt7jwh.text: A few years later, I followed them. I was 16 years old.

-JrjI_hwvToXhnGrXMDb.text: That’s another story but it’s connected.

-JrjI_hwvToXhnGrXMDc.text: When I saw those families leave I wanted to do the same.

-JrjI_hwvToXhnGrXMDd.text: It’s also because they stayed in Israel that I had to come back.

-JrjI_hx9uCYWG8qCAxP.text: Morocco gained independence from France in 1956. That same year, it made Jewish immigration to Israel illegal.

-JrjI_hx9uCYWG8qCAxQ.text: The ban was lifted five years later, after a ship, leased by Mossad, sank. All 44 Moroccan Jews on board died.

-JrjI_hx9uCYWG8qCAxR.text: By 1974, The Moroccan Jewish population in Israel had soared to 400,000.

-JrjI_hyrP9uJNES9cT_.text: Still, some resisted. They chose to remain in Morocco.

-JrjI_hzdWbo3vUHnHfx.text: I started to work as a sales representative.

-JrjGghO-3odoN3c1pzO.text: كانت القيادة السياسية لمنظمة التحرير في تونس. ومع زخم الانتفاضة زاد تواصلها مع قادة الميدان من النشطاء في الضفة الغربية وقطاع غزة.

-JrjGghPeBFhFxpEMkUM.text: اصبحت الارض المحتلة هي الساحة الوحيدة الي ممكن لهذه القيادة ان تلعب بها وتحافظ على شرعيتها ووجودها. للاسف الشديد انا بقولك بالسنة الثانية للانتفاضة اصبحت تونس تتدخل بشكل سلبي لانو هم في واد والناس في واد وبداوا يتدخلون في صياغة الشباب هون مضطرين يبعثوا لتونس البيان بيان القيادة الوطنية الموحدة رقم عشرة او عشرين او ثلاثين من باب العلاقة ومن اجل انو يبعثوا شوية مصاري.

-JrjGghQK_epkJk7VT5h.text: خليل الوزير أبو جهاد كان الرجل رقم واحد في حركة فتح، والمتابع لما يحدث داخل الأراضي الفلسطينية المحتلة.

-JrjGghTb0m4KI7W4-tL.text: بعد نفيه إلى الخارج، أصبح حسام خضر إلى جانب عدد من قيادات الانتفاضة، على اتصال مباشر مع قيادة منظمة التحرير في تونس.

-JrjGghUJXvf1rH5F6F6.text: الفساد كان مستشري في مؤسسات منظمة التحرير وبالتالي احنا كان يصلنا من الموازنات الي كان من شأنها انو تنقلنا نقلة نوعية باتجاه مقاومة شعبية ومسلحة، كان يصلنا الفتات وكلو كان يتقصقص على الطريق في جيوب المسؤولين وهذه حقيقة وضعتها انا والاخ مروان امام الاخ ابو جهاد في اجتماع تقريبا استغرق اربع ساعات في 12/4/88 في بيت ابو سعيد يعني قبل اربع ايام من استشهاده .

-JrjGghV6iKqjQdMyc_F.text: في السادس عشر من ابريل نيسان عام ثمانية وثمانين، قامت خلية اسرائيلية باقتحام منزل خليل الوزير أبو جهاد في العاصمة التونسية، واغتياله.

-JrjGghWRyZA7uqyQ_-J.text: يضمن التكتيك الذي استخدم لمحاربة الارهاب ملاحقة القيادات. وكانوا يعرفون انهم مستهدفين بصفتهم يشغلون مناصب قيادية، لذا كان من الصعب عليهم التركيز في تحقيق غاياتهم الارهابية.

-JrjGghXXkaZzrHiv9-2.text: واذا كان شخص كفؤ يشغل منصباً قيادياً، فإن من سيخلفه لن يتمتع بذات الكفاءة.

-JrjGghYC6fUxLGfmVYl.text: لم يدرك قادة العرب في بادئ الأمر أهمية الانتفاضة. لكن، بحلول السنة الثانية، لم يستطع أحد تجاهل الحراك الشعبي الفلسطيني التواق إلى الحرية..

-JrjGghYC6fUxLGfmVYm.text: في نهاية تموز/يوليو عام ثمانية وثمانين، قرر الأردن فك ارتباطه بالضفة الغربية الذي بدأ سنة ألف وتسعمئة وخمسين.

-JrjGghZr0JGongZ28sr.text: بينما كان الفلسطينيون في الأراضي المحتلة يواجهون الاحتلال، أعلن ياسر عرفات في الجزائر القبول بقرار مجلس الأمن رقم 242، ودخلت انتفاضة الحجارة مرحلة جديدة.

-JrjGgh_-XPxkhcotmjM.text: الانتفاضة الحقيقية أنا بتقديري صارت ربما عشرون شهر متماسكه قويه صلبه، وهناك قدر من السيطره إلى مدى بعيد عليها من قبل القيادة الموحدة توجيهاً وتنظيماً وتركيماً للإنجازات والأهداف السياسية. والإنتفاضة فلسفتها ورسالتها بسيطه لم يكن أحد منا يتوقع أنها ستُنهي الإحتلال.

-JrjGgh_-XPxkhcotmjN.text: لكن الرسالة التي أريد إيصالها أن الشعب الفلسطيني لا يريد هذا الإحتلال، ويريد تقرير مصير والعودة والإستقلال، ببساطه شديده وقولٌ واحد، وهذه الرسالة أنا بتقديري وصلت إلى العالم أجمع وليست الرسالة الإسرائيلية التي تقول أن الأراضي المحتله هي نموذج للتعايش العربي الإسرائيلي.

-JrjGghawrLjZ1LLs5S2.text: خلال العام 1989 وحده هدمت إسرائيل أكثر من 120 منزلاً فلسطينيا واعتقلت عشرات الآلاف.

-JrjIQWx8SRvMw3yvPNZ.text: Twenty years after Israel captured the Palestinian territories in the 1967 Six-Day War; massive protests erupted across the occupied territories.

-JrjIQWyBlUg5sFMDVWV.text: Half a million Palestinians took to the streets to demand an end to the Israeli occupation.

-JrjIQWyBlUg5sFMDVWW.text: Eighty thousand Israeli soldiers were ordered to contain the uprising.

-JrjIQWzc8_WfKTCGi6D.text: As weapons the Palestinians used not guns or bombs...  But stones.

-JrjIQWzc8_WfKTCGi6E.text: After six years over 1,300 Palestinians had been killed.

-JrjIQX-2XPk5tO-z8xk.text: This film features the photographs of Lebanese-American photographer, George Azar, who documented the 1987 Palestinian uprising.

-JrjIQX0Pi-f8eUPEGDl.text: In this two-part series we go back to meet some of the people who appeared in Azar’s work and talk to them about the uprising, almost three decades on.

-JrjIQX0Pi-f8eUPEGDm.text: In the summer of 1967, Israel’s occupation of the West Bank and the Gaza Strip began in full force.

-JrjIQX1K1PvEHEIPH1Q.text: Before 1967, half of all Palestinians made their living from the land.

-JrjIQX1K1PvEHEIPH1R.text: But Israel banned them from farming without permits.

-JrjIQX2klIvUB8ayfUe.text: Checkpoints prevented Palestinians from moving freely across their own land. Land which is at the heart of the Israeli-Palestinian conflict.

-JrjIQX3_4xoiXdBdcJN.text: For the first six months of the occupation, we couldn’t export anything. We started importing from Israel. Palestinians became economically dependent on Israel.  Farming began to disappear.  Older people were the only ones left doing it.  Young people were forced to find jobs in Israel. Our connection to the land was lost. This conflict is all about land.

-JrjIQX7t4umUeJ3TuxY.text: In the ten years after the 1967 occupation Israel built 45 settlements in the occupied West Bank and Gaza.

-JrjIQX7t4umUeJ3TuxZ.text: Even Palestinians living in Israel with Israeli passports had their land confiscated. By March 1976, they’d had enough.  They organized their first public protest against Israeli policy.

-JrjIQX8IqFSGNv1qI7I.text: Six unarmed Palestinians were shot dead by Israeli security forces.  A hundred more were wounded.

-JrjIQX9WNtg6lbosamb.text: Then, on 30th March 1976, solidarity protests erupted across the occupied West Bank. This became known as Land Day.

-JrjIQXA_fmaJ_nU6tux.text: Protests continued over the next couple of months, gaining momentum. There were whispers of an Intifada… An uprising.

-JrjIQXBsZPluX4DAYrz.text: In May, 1976, at a protest in Nablus, the Israeli army shot dead Lina al-Nabulsi, a 15-year-old unarmed girl.

-JrjIQXBsZPluX4DAYs-.text: On the ground, Palestinians decided the violence called for a political response.

-JrjIQXCI5cCly0jNETO.text: UNIFIED NATIONAL LEADERSHIP OF THE UPRISING

-JrjIQXDKI8SYILQrywS.text: The Intifada of 1976 lasted for months. Forty-eight Palestinians were killed. This led to the creation of PLO electoral lists in towns and villages, fighting for Palestine’s freedom. Before, these lists had been banned.

-JrjIQXFAvyakm-qI2yK.text: Palestinian mayors created a national committee to organise these new resistance groups.

-JrjIQXG8JVZKI1Sv3BS.text: Muayyad Abdul Samad recalls how the time represented a political turning point for the Palestinians.

-JrjIQXHdL1TDT747ig5.text: Palestinians’ national awareness grew. It was expressed in different ways, some official.

-JrjIQXI0_qx87vt-Ggn.text: They formed volunteer, cultural and student committees.

-JrjIQXJOyE_YvkHQTjX.text: All shared the same national dream. To end the occupation peacefully.

-JrjIQXKcxuMTIlIBkZ0.text: Israel countered the rise of Palestinian nationalism by creating a parallel leadership structure.

-JrjIQXKcxuMTIlIBkZ1.text: They called them the village leagues. Publicly, they were headed by local Palestinian leaders.  But behind the scenes, Israel pulled all the strings.

-JrjIQXM6tbQfw3u0-Cs.text: ‘Village leagues’ opened in many Palestinian towns and cities. They were created as an alternative to the Palestine Liberation Organization.

-JrjIQXM6tbQfw3u0-Cu.text: You had to get permits from the village league.  If you were linked to any Palestinian faction, you’d be refused.

-JrjIQXNHKdka7wa4_ig.text: The village leagues failed to contain the protest movement. League members were viewed as Israeli collaborators and punished for their betrayal.

-JrjIQXOlZZi6EKDmmZe.text: Several were assassinated…. All to send a clear message to Israel.

-JrjIQXPMj7m6wgFfQsB.text: In the summer of 1980, Israeli assassins targeted the mayors of Nablus, Ramallah and El-Bireh with car bombs.

-JrjIQXQkB8DWLAPByYD.text: Militant political groups – including Islamic Jihad – began to emerge, vowing to end the occupation by any means necessary.

-JrjIQXSRqtyUhwpU8SP.text: Leader of the Islamic Jihad Movement

-JrjIQXSRqtyUhwpU8SQ.text: The Islamic Jihad movement had the honour of igniting Palestinian resistance in the early 1980s.  These years were difficult for Palestinians.

-JrjIQXT6dGjwUIDEHCv.text: The PLO was still negotiating with Israel. It tried to find solutions and compromises with Israel.

-JrjIQXVVCZ7vBZKV9Xg.text: Tensions continued to mount. Over the next year a series of events, one after another, would bring things to a head.

-JrjIQXVVCZ7vBZKV9Xh.text: In December 1986, two members of the Muslim Brotherhood, Saeb Dahab and Jawad Abu Salmieh, were shot dead by Israeli soldiers during a student march at Beirzeit University near Ramallah.

-JrjIQXXvE3dSO2IehJa.text: The resistance within the Islamic movement kept growing. Clashes with the Israeli army kept happening, like the one at Beirzeit, where two young men were killed.

-JrjIQXYtfhdQ2JlNQfT.text: The militant movement started in the mosques and civil society.  Society was becoming more religious. Resistance grew within a religious framework. This was the incubator for the First Intifada.

-JrjIQX_A_4Wn3mPrXOw.text: On 6th October 1987, six members of Islamic Jihad who’d escaped from prison earlier that year were killed in an Israeli ambush.

-JrjIQX_A_4Wn3mPrXOx.text: The killings triggered more protests, which inevitably led to more deaths.

-JrjIQXaGyiYrwMkzKYO.text: During street demonstrations in Gaza’s Shuja'iyya district one Israeli soldier and four Islamic Jihad fighters were killed.

-JrjIQXaGyiYrwMkzKYP.text: A few days later, Intisar Al-Attar was shot in the back by an Israeli settler in Gaza.  She was 17-years-old.

-JrjIQXg_An8V3nZzKpc.text: FMR UNIFIED NATIONAL LEADERSHIP OF THE UPRISING

-JrjIQXg_An8V3nZzKpd.text: The incident made Palestinians realise That not just their rights were being threatened.   But also their lives.

-JrjIQXiLmTaJ5isxE8o.text: An Israeli settler opened fire on Intisar Al-Attar at school. Israeli forces arrested the settler. But the court realesed him a week later. Saying he’d  acted in legitimate self-defense.

-JrjIQXj7jMT7Gr6ocyH.text: Meanwhile, on the international stage, it appeared the Arab World had forgotten the Palestinians.  The Arab summit in Amman, Jordan focused instead on the Iran-Iraq War.

-JrjIQXkR-vRT_jPE6oz.text: Back in Israel, two Arab resistance fighters launched a daring attack on an army base that killed six Israeli soldiers.  They’d entered Israel from South Lebanon on hang gliders.

-JrjIQXlpHEIrqKgai5g.text: Less than two weeks later, an Israeli army truck rammed into a group of Palestinians near Gaza’s Jabalya refugee camp, killing four people and injuring seven more.

-JrjIQXma0bcCs4K1TFU.text: Israel claimed it was an accident. Palestinians believed it was deliberate.

-JrjIQXma0bcCs4K1TFV.text: Azzizeh Abdul Fatah Daher was there.

-JrjIQXn9v8nfP_K5JCK.text: The military truck ran people over.  We ran after the truck.  The Israelis buried them in the desert.

-JrjIQXptM1PQ1XjKk04.text: Safwat Kahlout is a Palestinian journalist who recalls how the next morning would prove historic.

-JrjIQXq1_4VN10KRHSi.text: After the burial, the victims’ families attacked the police station.  The police opened fire. At that moment, we felt something new was happening.

-JrjIQXsJCKQMU2bDtuP.text: Students gathered, surrounded the military trucks and started throwing stones. The Israeli soldiers hid in this house. They felt threatened and opened fire in all directions.

-JrjIQXtJPFKaX_KQ4s6.text: Many were injured, including my cousin, Ahmad Kahlut.

-JrjIQXuHR0nohZ0sOKd.text: That day, Hatem Abu Sesi died. This square was named after him.  He was the first victim of the Intifada.

-JrjIQXvdih252YDFSKP.text: The 8th of December, 1987, marked the official start of the First Intifada.

-JrjIQXw2HTFNF9jHIHZ.text: Palestinians had no real weapons. So they threw stones at Israeli soldiers.

-JrjIQXxqhUQoiXoxqvV.text: FMR UNIFIED NATIONAL LEADERSHIP OF THE UPRISING 87-93

-JrjIQXy8Gy1HzIwCuAI.text: When the Israelis surrounded the mosque, we clashed with the army. Twenty of us got hit, including me.  Four others were killed.

-JrjIQXzbyuEBSuOjGCZ.text: The Intifada that started in Belata Camp in Nablus spread across all of the Palestinian territories.

-JrjIQY-_fi694oNaAN-.text: One of the first victims from the Balata refugee camp was Sahar Ahmed Jermi. Her mother recalls the last time she saw her alive.

-JrjIQY13mZ4Q5BC57i6.text: That Friday, we went to visit my son. When we came back the camp was in chaos.

-JrjIQY2YMNaUG6-gC76.text: The Israelis separated men from women. When my daughter saw that, she screamed ‘Women, rise up. The youth have been taken’.

-JrjIQY4eF-jI4dwmaRh.text: The demonstration started. After prayers, a demonstration started.  The Israelis started shooting. About 30 people were injured. People said, 'Your daughter’s been killed'.

-JrjIQY6_qhGKbGYoWQt.text: Jermi’s six brothers were in an Israeli jail when she was killed.   Her parents were the only family members able to bury her.

-JrjIQY8-VCwEepEq8u-.text: MOTHER OF INTIFADA VICTIM SAHAR JERMI

-JrjIQY8-VCwEepEq8u0.text: I saw the Israelis and young  people fighting.  I grabbed stones and threw them at the Israelis. They handcuffed me, arrested me and took me away, I got six months in jail.

-JrjIQYB6FF616nFmz4E.text: The Intifada came as a surprise to the Palestine Liberation Organization. Leader Yasser Arafat watched events unfold from his exiled base in Tunisia.

-JrjIQYB6FF616nFmz4F.text: The PLO had been the only organization that could claim to represent the Palestinians. That would change with the creation of The Unified National Leadership of the Uprising – the UNLU.

-JrjIQYC9EYHPtdlBSNx.text: THE DEMOCRATIC FRONT FOR THE LIBERATION OF PALESTINE

-JrjIQYD_9XcIGgetN-U.text: The UNLU was made up of three factions: Fatah, the Popular Front and the Democratic Front. Later, the Palestinian People’s Party formerly known as the Palestine communist Party, joined.

-JrjIQYE5mxatJdDb-ot.text: The UNLU channelled Palestinians enthusiasm for street demonstrations into other organised acts of civil disobedience like Labour strikes.

-JrjIQYFXa7WO7UoL5RN.text: Members of the People’s Party don’t usually pray, but we noticed everyone was at the mosques. Demonstrations happened on Fridays.  We distributed thousands of leaflets across Gaza. People’s participation began participating more than before. We told those working in Israel to go on strike.  That’s how the second week of the Intifada began.

-JrjIQYHKb8ubMFwAyQy.text: Islamic movements started to play a more prominent role in the Intifada. Nafith Azzam recalls how his movement, Islamic Jihad, fuelled the uprising.

-JrjIQYJ8U97q4K230OZ.text: Islamic Jihad accelerated things. It led to what the world now knows as the Intifada The Jihad movement did its best to work with other factions, even though it was not part of the UNLU.

-JrjIQYMbgznCIV3z5zW.text: The head of the University met with the head of the Muslim Brotherhood in the Gaza. We decided to show support for our people. We agreed the Islamic student bloc inside the University would help initiate campaigns inside and outside of the University.

-JrjIQYOIfBhPJcdGM38.text: Some people called the First Intifada the ‘Revolution of the Mosques’.  The mosques were the birthplace of the Palestinian resistance movement.   There was a secular force, but the Islamic influence was felt, even within Fatah.

-JrjIQYQghxhLojib8hY.text: The Intifada grew. It gathered support from other countries, factions, trade unions, businesses and universities. Business owners were asked to take part in strikes. The Intifada aimed to remove the Israeli army from the cities and camps. It ultimately wanted to establish a Palestinian state and end the occupation. Popular committees encouraged direct participation in the movement.

-JrjIQYT4AdJT3DGdq9h.text: I remember a leaflet published in Gaza saying: ‘Did you scare an Israeli soldier today? Did you participate in creating popular committees? Or take part in social solidarity?'

-JrjIQYUNGkW9kwpan1g.text: Then it included some task that needed to be done. This had a direct impact on people.

-JrjIQYUNGkW9kwpan1h.text: There was no longer any doubt about what was happening:  a national uprising against a colonial power that had been ruling Palestinians through military occupation since 1967.

-JrjIQYV36MqBiMnHGIy.text: Palestinian workers were a powerful force for the Intifada.  Half the workers in Gaza and a third of those in the occupied West Bank traveled to Israel every day to earn a living.

-JrjIQYXa85lzLiDt5lI.text: On weekends the streets would be crowded with Palestinian workers. Most workers from Gaza had jobs in Israel.

-JrjIQYZOG1w-5kDOUgs.text: FMR UNIFIED NATIONAL LEADERSHIP OF THE UPRISING

-JrjIQYZOG1w-5kDOUgt.text: In the West Bank it was more difficult.  There was already a Palestinian political structure in place.  So resistance movements couldn’t have as much power.  We had to tell people there were groups to lead them, with a plan to meet their immediate needs on one hand and achieve a collective national goal.

-JrjIQYaLTfENIFSWGwv.text: Without coherent leadership, Palestinians began to worry the Intifada wouldn’t last.

-JrjIQYbm5zNXmSpCDFt.text: Increasingly, the exiled leadership of the PLO seemed out of touch with what was unfolding on the ground. New political forces -- the UNLU and the Islamic movements -- had influence within the Palestinian territories, but no clout internationally.

-JrjIQYbm5zNXmSpCDFu.text: It was unclear how the simmering tensions between the PLO and the Intifada leaders could be resolved.

-JrjIQYceIaELRQo5oVi.text: Palestinians don't want occupation. They want self- determination to return to their land and settle. It's simple and united.

-JrjIQYceIaELRQo5oVj.text: When the Palestinian Intifada began in December 1987, it captured the world’s attention.

-JrjIQYceIaELRQo5oVk.text: Israel had never encountered anything like the Intifada before. Military commanders had to decide how to deal with an uprising they saw as a threat to their national security.

-JrjIQYdLCKLsfr29cso.text: In this film, we revisit some of the people captured in photographs taken by George Azar, a Lebanese-American journalist.

-JrjIQYdLCKLsfr29csp.text: During the Intifada, Amram Mitzna was an Israeli commander.

-JrjIQYfvFhPzcuGvbyV.text: The surprise was that it spread from north to south and from east to west,  Everyplace, you could see the same system, which was not actually a system, but the same behavior,  Children, women and of course young even kids demonstrating, with many many people participating in this shouting, yelling, throwing stones and sometimes Molotov cocktails, that  challenging our forces was we couldn’t use all the powers that we could have had.

-JrjIQYgw1vIMEb_mBB3.text: You couldn’t let them rule, or control the main roads in the cities or the main roads between the villages.

-JrjIQYgw1vIMEb_mBB4.text: So the biggest challenge was to brief our soldiers how to behave in such situation.

-JrjIQYhGjwDZqQ3YbSW.text: Palestinians were victims of harassment, even when they played no part in the Intifada.

-JrjIQYi_C9MLtstPc_S.text: The Palestinian workers, who flooded into Israel every day, fuelling its economy, could now have a say.

-JrjIQYjgjSQ6iT7agbj.text: Israel claimed the occupied territories were a model of coexistence between Arabs and Israelis.

-JrjIQYk78fELnlbJ-j5.text: A model for Arabs to learn from.

-JrjIQYk78fELnlbJ-j6.text: The Intifada erupted even though Palestinian workers made a living, Workers suffered the worst humiliation and discrimination from the occupation. Palestinian nationalism never faded.

-JrjIQYllQYGLZE8Zlx4.text: Israel responded with mass arrests.  It also decided to call up its reserve forces.

-JrjIQYnl2XuSDzmYCYC.text: RETIRED ISRAELI GENERAL – LEADER OF THE MIDDLE FRONT

-JrjIQYoHfzv-7UMYuHT.text: In the beginning of the Intifada, December 1987, we’ve had about i think 13 – 15 companies, which means, let's say 1000 soldiers – a month later i think we've have had, let’s say 8,000 – 10,000 soldiers, most of them regular forces because we understood that we need to bring a lot of soldiers if we want to meet the challenges that we have met in every corner and at every road junction in the west bank….

-JrjIQYoHfzv-7UMYuHV.text: But we didn’t try to be in each village and each place but understood that we have to make the transportation safer on the main roads and of course to protect the settlers.

-JrjIQYpu15sj8tXGZ0_.text: Yitzhak Rabin was Israel’s defence minister at the time.  He’s been accused of ordering the Israeli army to break the bones of Palestinians

-JrjIQYrvvJBT2jtbkOx.text: Retired Israeli General – leader of the middle front

-JrjIQYrvvJBT2jtbkOy.text: Well, I understood immediately that the soldiers will translate the aim of the minister of defence, Yitzhak Rabin, and what they heard him say – they will translate it immediately to a behaviour which I didn’t want them to take.

-JrjIQYrvvJBT2jtbkOz.text: I was afraid, I was worried, -  you know soldiers are watching television or listening to the radio and the channel of command instead of going minister of defense, chief of staff,  me, the commander of the west bank , the talion leaders, company leaders squad leaders. The channel of command will go directly from television to the soldiers.

-JrjIQYsma29mRG0zSpD.text: On the 26th February 1988, four Israeli soldiers attacked two Palestinian teenagers with stones.

-JrjIQYtIpqlf2EnliPM.text: Wael Hassan Jawda was one of the victims.

-JrjIQYuQtA9lRt8H7V_.text: We were herding our sheep in the mountains. I was surprised to see soldiers. They started hitting me and shouting. They spoke Hebrew, which I didn’t understand. One thing sticks in my mind.  On one soldiers’ helmet was written: ‘Born to kill Palestinians’. He read it to me and told me what it meant.

-JrjIQYwy5p_mbmqlPuA.text: A nearby CBS News cameraman filmed what happened. The footage was shown all over the world.

-JrjIQYxTldW1v6puxP7.text: People thought the teenagers had been tortured to death, but they survived, and were thrown in jail.

-JrjIQYxTldW1v6puxP8.text: While he was under arrest, Jawda met Amram Mitzna, the commander of Israel’s Central command.

-JrjIQYzKEu9g6HQenkv.text: I remember he told me ‘the whole world thinks you’re both dead’. He was an Israeli soldier and he said: 'The whole world thinks you’re dead'.

-JrjIQYzKEu9g6HQenkx.text: The film made by the journalists, regardless of their nationality, was a good thing. If they hadn’t filmed it, I could have been treated worst. Maybe I’d still be in jail today.

-JrjIQZ0KDi-qRGvCQ5x.text: The Israeli army used a range of weapons against peaceful demonstrators.

-JrjIQZ0KDi-qRGvCQ5y.text: In March 1988, during an International Women’s Day protest in occupied East Jerusalem, they sprayed tear gas.

-JrjIQZ0KDi-qRGvCQ5z.text: Randa Jaberi took part in that march decades ago.

-JrjIQZ2EgN9PgpFjsl7.text: This is Salah e-Din Street. Here is when they sprayed us with tear gas.   They sprayed gas with hoses. They would hose a whole group of people. I got exposed and fainted. My mum also got but she was stronger than me.

-JrjIQZ4jYcfwA_QsNgJ.text: Palestinian refugee camps are labyrinths of narrow streets and houses.  The ideal battlefield for clashes between Palestinians and Israeli soldiers. Nasser Abu Rish recalls his experience.

-JrjIQZ65M2BEO6Q5ZlB.text: One day they took us. We were unconscious. They handcuffed us, threw us on the ground and hit us. My crime was throwing stones. This was the first thing they would accuse us of.  Even if you were just a bystander, you were accused of throwing stones.

-JrjIQZ8KBC1R__E1p_m.text: Jewish settlers also attacked Palestinians. Saari Hamayel remembers what happened in his village of Beita.

-JrjIQZAE_769SlPse1m.text: On 6th April, the settlers entered Beita from the east. The person leading them was called Roman Aldubi. He entered with 15 other people. They had guns, Uzzis and M16s. They approached the young people. It was planting season. They opened fire on the first person they saw.  He died on his way to hospital.

-JrjIQZEzNw0OZ7u4rds.text: His name was Moussa Abu Shamsa. He was 19 years old.

-JrjIQZF96hNfeVjSv56.text: On the same day, Teresa Borat, a 15-year-old Israeli settler was killed.

-JrjIQZF96hNfeVjSv57.text: According to witnesses, Borat was shouting at Roman Al Dubi to stop him from opening fire, but he killed her, either deliberately or by accident.

-JrjIQZF96hNfeVjSv58.text: Israel accused Palestinians of killing Borat and ordered the destruction of the village of Beita. An autopsy confirmed she’d been killed by Al Dubi’s gun.

-JrjIQZGc1nH-49rpTFt.text: Two hundred Palestinians were arrested. Fourteen homes were demolished and eight activists expelled from the Palestinian territories.

-JrjIQZHHCWzpb7GKpA4.text: Hamayel’s home was demolished. He was exiled.

-JrjIQZHHCWzpb7GKpA5.text: His pregnant wife, Sa’eda and their two daughters managed to escape. She remembers how Israeli soldiers scoured Beita, trying to find her.

-JrjIQZIsLUne4Ow4yaB.text: The head of every household said: ‘Let’s just give her to the Israelis and get rid of [this problem]’. My mum told me to leave home, because we didn’t know what would happen. So we stayed where we could, and we stayed in this miserable place.

-JrjIQZKgLtMS1YUAAr2.text: Israel’s response to the Intifada wasn’t limited to targeting protestors.  It also involved the demolition of Palestinian homes.  During the first year of intifada, Israel demolished more than 350 in Gaza alone.

-JrjIQZM-b43bxVOex1Z.text: RETIRED ISRAELI GENERAL – LEADER OF THE MIDDLE FRONT

-JrjIQZNSGeHZWvbPuKf.text: Demolishing homes came basically from the British period of time in Palestine. And we adapted it, years before the Intifada. Of course during the Intifada we used it more often. We felt we have to deter in some way the way that families and friends and villagers supported those who didn’t just demonstrate but used Molotov cocktails or even hand grenades or weapons.

-JrjIQZOTz0eZe-udQtm.text: And in order to deter, it’s not enough to catch them and to bring them to court and to put them into prison, so we used the deportation, we used also the idea of blowing houses.

-JrjIQZPRbMDfFmw1Dfe.text: The Intifada also saw 600,000 Palestinians arrested. Including those who had no connection with the uprising at all.  Issa Faleh is one of them.

-JrjIQZRoloB6bM-M7mz.text: I was at home, talking with my nephew. Suddenly we saw soldiers entering. We'd no idea what we'd done.

-JrjIQZSZBA0PYNej0kd.text: Um Alaa Matar, was 15 years old at the time of the Intifada.

-JrjIQZT6ABEClL7ppK7.text: Someone said some young people had been hit. Everyone came to see what happened. Each time something happened, I went out to protest and block the streets.

-JrjIQZVsr5FUXG_olfX.text: During the Intifada, two of my brothers were hit and one was arrested. Our family didn’t know when we went out.. Everyone’s brothers  and sons were outside. No one’s life is better than anyone else’s.

-JrjIQZW-G6kH80KcNJK.text: Matar raised the banned Palestinian flag on the hill of Beita. This picture became an iconic symbol of Palestinian history.

-JrjIQZXedDC9QCxQtzK.text: Meanwhile, in Tunis, Yasser Arafat and the PLO started to take notice.

-JrjIQZYdl2mRgdA3q2-.text: We didn’t realise an Intifada was happening. We knew we had to support the people.  We had to monitor budgets for universities, schools and hospitals

-JrjIQZ_5SHQ1naPjqmn.text: Israel imposed a blockade on finance, aid, and international volunteers Arafat didn’t think people’s Intifada would last that long.

-JrjIQZarJ7QQ1fOSSnG.text: Palestinian politicians recall how the momentum generated by the Intifada drew the PLO leadership in Tunis into a dialogue with the Intifada leaders in the occupied West Bank and the Gaza Strip.

-JrjIQZb3Jv3KLMTLY8I.text: THE UNIFIED NATIONAL LEADERSHIP OF THE UPRISING

-JrjIQZb3Jv3KLMTLY8J.text: The occupied territories became the only area where the UNLU could  have legitimacy and exist.

-JrjIQZc_i-ydJaKksKf.text: Unfortunately, during the second year of the Intifada the PLO  got involved  in a negative way. We were in two different worlds.  We had to involve the PLO in decision making if we wanted them to send us money.

-JrjIQZdI-J_9g_0VXG-.text: Khalil Al Wazir, also known as Abu Jihad, was senior leader of the Fatah movement. He strengthened the PLO’s connections with the UNLU.

-JrjIQZk2b9_jORecMRI.text: DEMOCRATIC FRONT FOR THE LIBERATION OF PALESTINE

-JrjIQZquYupTIhdjh96.text: Abu Jihad dealt on a daily basis with the Unified National Leadership. He coordinated most of his acts with UNLU leader.

-JrjIQZzosJGCzHr0GHi.text: UNIFIED LNATIONAL LEADERSHIP OF THE UPRISING

-JrjIQ_-nOj9eQopWAt1.text: Corruption soared in the PLO. From budgets for popular and armed resistance, We received only crumbs. The rest lined the leaders’ pockets. I raised the issue along with Abu Jihad in a meeting that lasted more than four hours on 12th April 1988,  four days before Abu Jihad was killed.

-JrjIQ_2WEcsshLXjdO-.text: Abu Jihad’s role in unifying the PLO with the Intifada leaders made him a prime target for the Israelis. On the 16th of April 1988, an Israeli cell attacked his house in Tunis and killed him.

-JrjIQ_4yRcUMNj3p8J7.text: The tactic to be used in fighting terrorism has included going after some of the leading people on the assumption that people in leading positions of a terrorist movement  know that they are being targeted – makes it difficult for them to concentrate their mind on what they are really set out to do, namely, acts of terrorism. And if you happen to get somebody who is very capable in the leadership – whoever replaces them after he is gone will not be as capable as the man who is gone.

-JrjIQ_5ot8Joligf6Ug.text: When the Intifada began, Arab leaders were unsure of what to make of it.  But as it entered its second year, no one could ignore the powerful popular movement. Politically for the Palestinians, things were shifting.

-JrjIQ_7EY99smEU03V2.text: There was a growing sense of disillusionment with the PLO’s strategy of negotiating with Israel.

-JrjIQ_7EY99smEU03V3.text: The UNLU became increasingly influential as some Palestinians lost trust in the PLO.

-JrjIQ_7EY99smEU03V4.text: Yasser Arafat’s approval of UN Security Council resolution 242, which implicitly recognised Israel, was seen by some as a step towards peace.

-JrjIQ_8K8BxI-yzJ0OI.text: But his decision seemed at odds with the Palestinian uprising in the occupied territories.

-JrjIQ_9ECCzSf1Jjcek.text: I think the Intifada lasted 20 months, strong and firm.   The UNLU controlled its organisation, direction, achievements and political goals.

-JrjIQ_A20hUAPhErzvw.text: The Intifada message was simple. No one of us expected it to end the occupation. But the message is that the Palestinian people don’t want occupation. They want to self- determination, to return to their land and to settle. Its simple and united.

-JrjIQ_CLaAX1bym8IEx.text: The whole world has received this message. And it’s not the Israeli message that the occupied territories were a model of coexistence

-JrjIQ_CLaAX1bym8IEz.text: Palestinians were projecting a powerful new image to the world.

-JrjIQ_DpCw1Lla1xkB8.text: In the next episode we will hear more stories from the people who lived through the Intifada nearly three decades ago.  They recall how it changed Palestinian culture and leadership.  And how it transformed Palestinian society forever.

-Js53wVaABdckYG9F8jv.text: Islamic Jihad wasn’t the only Islamic movement to emerge from the Intifada. In 1987, The Muslim Brotherhood circulated a leaflet at the Islamic University of Gaza.  It announced the creation of Hamas

-Js56y6hqnLbm4fn58vh.text: The Intifada in the Gaza Strip had exploded. It just needed organization

-Js5QGgslb1yefBeZ7oS.text: The Intifada had begun but nobody was quite sure how – or if – it would end.

-JrjH8jgVHceRzIigwJ0.text: مع دخول الانتفاضة عامها الثاني، واصل الشعب الفلسطيني كفاحه ضد الاحتلال، وطوّر إلى جانب الحجارة وسائل جديدة للمقاومة، متحدياً اسرائيل عسكرياً وثقافياً واقتصادياً. هنا نروي بعض حكايات من انتفاضة الحجارة.

-JrjH8jh0-x6g5dku72U.text: أواخر عام 88 كانت بلدة بيت ساحور قرب من مدينة بيت لحم في الضفة الغربية تشيع أبناءها شهداء.

-JrjH8jh0-x6g5dku72V.text: فقد كان لها نصيبها في دفع ثمن مقاومة الاحتلال الاسرائيلي خلال الانتفاضة الأولى.

-JrjH8jj85BhG9S-7z-1.text: الي تميزت فيه بيت ساحور بالدرجة الاولى هو رفض دفع الضريبة لحكومة غير حكومة فلسطين، لانه اخذا بالمبدأ والشعار الامريكي no taxation without  representation لا لدفع الضرائب من دون تمثيل، يعني انه حكومة غير حكومتنا مناخذ منها خدمات وبالعكس مندفعلهم مصاري وهمه بجيبولنا اكثر، جيش اكثر عسكري واكثر يعني آليات اللي بستخدموها ضد الشعب الفلسطيني او لقمع الشعب الفلسطيني. اول شي السلطات الاسرائيلية وجيش الاحتلال حاصر المدينة لمدة تقريبا 40 يوم كان فيه اجتياحات يومية ومداهمات للبيوت والمنازل للناس الي لازم يدفعوا ضريبة  و ما دفعوا ضريبة.

-JrjH8jla9FZ_cgztfCN.text: راهب في الكنيسة الارثودكسية - بيت ساحور
